content.question: Researchers in plant growth are investigating the proportions of seedlings that sprout under two environmental settings in a lab experiment. Let <math alttext="P hat sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample proportion of seedlings that sprout in garden C, and let <math alttext="P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample proportion of seedlings that sprout in garden H. For random samples of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the sampling distribution of the difference between sample proportions <math alttext="P hat sub C minus P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> has <math alttext="sigma subscript, p hat sub C minus P hat sub H, end subscript, is approximately equal to 0.051" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>0.051</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the best interpretation of <math alttext="sigma subscript, P hat sub C minus P hat sub H, end subscript, is approximately equal to 0.051" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>σ</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>≈</mo><mn>0.051</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: For each sample of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the proportion of seedlings that sprout is approximately 0.051.

For each sample of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the difference in the proportion of seedlings that sprout <math alttext="P hat sub C minus P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is approximately 0.051.
For a randomly selected garden setting C seedling and a garden H seedling, the probability that both seedlings sprout is approximately 0.051.

For all random samples of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the mean of all possible differences between sample proportions <math alttext="P hat sub C minus P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is approximately 0.051.

For all random samples of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the average distance of all possible differences between sample proportions <math alttext="P hat sub C minus P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mean of the sampling distribution is approximately 0.051.

content.answer: For all random samples of 100 garden C seedlings and 100 garden H seedlings, the average distance of all possible differences between sample proportions <math alttext="P hat sub C minus P hat sub H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mean of the sampling distribution is approximately 0.051.

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
